intro: Cymbalaria flabellifer, commonly known as the flabellifer mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, fleshy leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. It is often found in areas with calcareous soils and is known for its ability to thrive in humid conditions. The flowers are usually pink or purple and attract various pollinators including bees and butterflies.
